squidpony.squidgrid.mapping

Class PacMazeGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.PacMazeGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDungeonGenerator

    public class PacMazeGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDungeonGenerator
    Meant to produce the sort of narrow, looping, not-quite-maze-like passages found in a certain famous early arcade game. Created by Tommy Ettinger on 3/30/2016.

      • PacMazeGenerator

        public PacMazeGenerator(int width,
                        int height,
                        int wallBreadth,
                        int passageBreadth,
                        IRNG rng)
        Parameters:
        width - the x-size of the maze map to produce
        height - the y-size of the maze map to produce
        wallBreadth - how thick wall sections should be; defaults to 2
        passageBreadth - how broad passages should be; defaults to 1
        rng - an IRNG, such as a RNG, which can be seeded

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public GreasedRegion create()

      • generate

        public char[][] generate()
        Description copied from interface: IDungeonGenerator
        Generates a dungeon or other map as a 2D char array. Any implementation may allow its own configuration and customization of how dungeons are generated, but each must provide this as a sane default. Most implementations should use the convention of '#' representing a wall and '.' representing a bare floor, but beyond that, anything could be present in the char array.
        Specified by:
        generate in interface IDungeonGenerator
        Returns:
        a 2D char array representing some kind of map, probably using standard conventions for walls/floors

      • getEnvironment

        public int[][] getEnvironment()

      • getMap

        public GreasedRegion getMap()
        Gets the maze as a 2D array of true for passable or false for blocked.
        Returns:
        a 2D boolean array; true is passable and false is not.

      • getMaze

        public char[][] getMaze()
        Gets the maze as a 2D array of ',' for passable or '#' for blocked.

        a 2D char array; '.' is passable and '#' is not.
